item.title: 为什么在休斯顿吃汉堡不如在芝加哥对气候友好？
item.description:
一项新研究发现，奶牛的产地对其碳足迹有很大影响。【原文：

Where cows come from plays a big role in their carbon footprint, a new study found.

】

item.title: 瑞典 Stegra 公司在寻求资金时引入重组专家
item.description: 瑞典绿色钢材初创公司 Stegra AB 任命了一位重组专家进入董事会，以避免资金紧张。【原文：Swedish green-steel startup Stegra AB appointed a restructuring expert to its board of directors as the company fights to stave off a funding crunch.】

item.title: MTA 在收费计划法律诉讼中出售 2.3 亿美元债务
item.description: 纽约市的交通网络正在寻求筹集 2.3 亿美元的短期债务，为今年早些时候实施的拥堵收费计划所需的基础设施提供资金。【原文：New York City’s transit network is seeking to raise $230 million in short-term debt to finance needed infrastructure for its congestion toll plan implemented earlier this year.】

item.title: 研究称，廉价能源削弱了西班牙清洁能源协议的蓬勃发展
item.description: 全球咨询公司 Alvarez & Marsal 表示，西班牙较低的电价正在影响该国清洁能源交易的繁荣，估值急剧下降。【原文：Spain’s lower electricity prices are denting the country’s clean-energy deals boom with a sharp decline in valuations, global advisory firm Alvarez & Marsal said.】

item.title: 根据新气候计划，印度将于 2045 年达到排放峰值
item.description: 作为世界第三大排放国，印度正在制定一项新的气候计划，预计到 2045 年达到排放峰值，比目前的排放轨迹提前十年。但有一个问题：它需要 21 万亿美元。【原文：India, the world’s third-largest emitter, is working on a new climate plan that sees emissions peaking in 2045, ten years earlier than its current trajectory. There’s a catch, though — it needs $21 trillion.】

item.title: 特朗普为何撤回他签署的削减超级污染物的法律
item.description:
美国环保署建议推迟淘汰家用空调和超市冰箱中使用的强力地球变暖气体。【原文：

The EPA is proposing delaying the switch out of powerful planet-warming gases used in home ACs and supermarket fridges.

】

item.title: 欧盟冯德莱恩在峰会前提出碳市场变革方案
item.description: 欧盟将在一个新的、有争议的碳市场中提出更强有力的措施来抑制排放成本，以解决消费者将难以负担家庭取暖和汽车加油的担忧。【原文：The European Union will propose stronger measures to curb emissions costs in a new and controversial carbon market to address concerns that consumers will struggle to afford to heat their homes and fill up cars.】

item.title: CMB 的绿色航运部门将完全拥有纳米比亚氢气项目
item.description: 比利时航运公司 CMB.TECH 在收购了一家当地合作伙伴的多数股权后，将成为纳米比亚绿色氢气项目的唯一股东。【原文：Belgian shipping company CMB.TECH will become the sole shareholder of a green hydrogen project in Namibia, after acquiring the majority stake of a local partner.】

item.title: 中国风能产业力争到 2030 年产能翻一番
item.description: 中国最大的涡轮机制造商正在游说政府在未来五年内每年安装至少 120 千兆瓦的风力发电能力，这将加速中国的能源转型，到本十年末，产量将翻一番多。【原文：China’s largest turbine makers are lobbying the government to install at least 120 gigawatts of wind power capacity in each of the next five years, an acceleration of the country’s energy transition that would more than double output by the end of the decade.】

item.title: 贝莱德的 GIP 与埃克森公司一起支持新的二氧化碳核算模式
item.description: 包括贝莱德全球基础设施合伙公司、埃克森美孚公司和桑坦德银行 SA 在内的一些公司已经联合起来，推动采用一种新的方法来衡量它们制造、购买和资助的产品的碳排放量。【原文：A group of firms including BlackRock Inc.’s Global Infrastructure Partners, Exxon Mobil Corp. and Banco Santander SA have joined forces to push for a new way to measure the carbon emissions of the products they make, buy and finance.】

item.title: 欧盟各国接近达成到 2027 年底禁止使用俄罗斯天然气的协议
item.description: 欧盟能源部长们希望就到 2027 年底禁止从俄罗斯供应所有天然气的计划达成一致立场，因为欧盟希望最终结束对莫斯科能源的依赖。【原文：European Union energy ministers aim to agree a joint position on plans to ban all gas supplies from Russia by the end of 2027, as the bloc looks to definitively end its reliance on energy from Moscow.】

item.title: 英国绿党报告在新领导人领导下会员人数激增
item.description: 英国绿党在报告其党员人数跃升之后，声称它现在是英国第三大党。【原文：The UK Green Party claims it is now the third largest in the country, after reporting a jump in its membership numbers.】

item.title: 英国清洁能源计划预计到 2030 年将增加 40 万个工作岗位
item.description: 英国力争在本十年末实现能源系统的去碳化，这将为英格兰东部和苏格兰带来最大的就业推动力。【原文：The UK’s push to decarbonize its energy system by the end of the decade will give the biggest employment boost to the East of England and Scotland.】

item.title: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼坚持其气候议程
item.description: 马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）在担任加拿大总理之前就已成为气候领袖。但自上任以来，他推行的政策被批评者认为无助于减排。在今天的时事通讯中，我们与卡尼讨论了他的计划和他认为的成功之处。【原文：Mark Carney established himself as climate leader before becoming Canada’s prime minister. Since taking office, though, he’s pursued policies that critics argue aren’t going to help cut emissions. In today’s newsletter, we talk with Carney about his plans and what he views as success.】

item.title: 瑞典 Stegra 在 Northvolt 的回声中面临资金紧张问题
item.description: 低碳钢初创公司 Stegra AB 本应成为瑞典绿色工业雄心的倡导者。现在，该公司面临资金紧张，正在寻求高达 9.75 亿欧元（约合 11.4 亿美元）的新融资，以支付高于预期的项目成本、为基础设施提供资金，并填补因国家拨款支持延迟而留下的缺口。【原文：Low-carbon steel startup Stegra AB was supposed to be a champion of Sweden’s green industrial ambitions. Now the company faces a funding crunch, and is seeking up to €975 million ($1.14 billion) in new financing to cover higher than expected project costs, fund infrastructure and fill a gap left by delays to state grant support.】

item.title: 欧洲需求减少，维斯塔斯波兰叶片工厂停工
item.description: 维斯塔斯风能系统公司（Vestas Wind Systems A/S）停止了在波兰生产海上风力涡轮机叶片的大型工厂的开发，原因是材料成本和利率的上升使该技术在欧洲的增长前景黯淡。【原文：Vestas Wind Systems A/S halted development of a major factory in Poland to produce blades for offshore wind turbines as higher costs from materials and interest rates dim the growth outlook for the technology in Europe.】

item.title: 特朗普如何迫使各国推迟征收航运碳税
item.description: 渴望遏制航运业造成的地球变暖污染的环保人士越来越相信，各国将在今年首次通过全球排放税。【原文：Environmentalists eager to curb planet-warming pollution from shipping had grown increasingly confident that countries would adopt the first-ever global tax on emissions this year.】

item.title: 美国反对派冻结全球船舶碳税
item.description: 本周，气候外交遇到了特朗普式的冰山。各国本打算就具有里程碑意义的规定做出决定，让船舶开始为其温室气体排放付费。周五，国际海事组织投票决定将这一决定推迟一年。【原文：This week, climate diplomacy ran into a Trump-sized iceberg. Nations were set to decide on landmark regulations to make vessels start paying for their greenhouse gas emissions. On Friday, the International Maritime Organization voted to postpone the decision for a year.】

item.title: 乍得与巴菲特支持的非洲公园续签合作协议
item.description: 就在结束与非洲公园组织长达 15 年的合作之后几天，乍得与非洲公园组织续签了管理其野生动物保护区的合作协议。【原文：Chad has renewed its partnership with African Parks to manage its wildlife reserves, just days after ending a 15-year collaboration with the initiative, which drew funding from the Rob Walton Foundation and Howard G. Buffett.】

item.title: 参议院民主党人敦促国际货币基金组织在特朗普压力下开展更多气候工作
item.description: 民主党参议员谢尔顿-怀特豪斯（Sheldon Whitehouse）敦促国际货币基金组织继续开展气候方面的工作，因为特朗普政府批评了国际货币基金组织在这一问题上的做法。【原文：Democratic Senator Sheldon Whitehouse urged the International Monetary Fund to keep up with its work on climate, as the Trump administration criticizes the lender’s approach to the topic.】

item.title: 特朗普颠覆谈判，航运监管机构推迟关键碳排放投票
item.description: 世界航运监管机构推迟了对船舶排放征收具有里程碑意义的费用的决定，这一令人震惊的举动凸显了特朗普政府破坏国际气候外交的努力。【原文：The world’s shipping regulator postponed a decision on adopting a landmark charge on vessel emissions, a shock move that highlights the Trump administration’s efforts to disrupt international climate diplomacy.】

item.title: 欧盟国家将推动推迟实施有争议的新碳市场
item.description: 欧盟一些国家将呼吁欧盟委员会主席乌苏拉-冯德莱恩（Ursula von der Leyen）推迟启动一个有争议的新碳市场，该市场旨在减少建筑物和公路运输产生的排放。【原文：A group of European Union countries will call on Commission President Ursula von der Leyen to delay the start of a controversial new carbon market designed to cut emissions from buildings and road transportation.】

item.title: 联合国称贫穷国家将比富裕国家更快变暖
item.description: 联合国在一份探讨气候变化如何加剧全球贫困的新报告中发现，世界上最贫穷的国家将比富裕的国家更快变热，而且每年变热的时间将更长。【原文：The world’s poorest countries are going to get hotter more quickly than wealthier nations, and will stay that way for a longer period each year, the United Nations found in a new report that looks at how climate change is worsening global poverty.】

item.title: 印度计划草案揭示了 21 万亿美元的净零投资需求
item.description: 根据彭博社看到的一份政府计划草案，印度将需要多达 21 万亿美元来实现其气候目标并使其人口摆脱贫困。【原文：India will need as much as $21 trillion to achieve its climate goals and lift its population out of poverty, according to a draft government plan seen by Bloomberg.】

item.title: Oklo 与英国核能公司将投资 20 亿美元建设燃料工厂
item.description: 英国一家陷入困境的核电初创公司 Newcleo Ltd. 已同意投资多达 20 亿美元，与美国反应堆开发商 Oklo Inc.【原文：Newcleo Ltd., a struggling UK nuclear startup, has agreed to invest as much as $2 billion to develop uranium fuel facilities in the US with American reactor developer Oklo Inc., a move aimed at expanding the supply chain for the fledgling fission industry.】

item.title: 新加坡建议推迟航运碳收费的关键投票
item.description: 新加坡建议各国推迟就是否向全球航运船队征收碳排放费进行投票，因为美国不断施压阻止该计划。【原文：Singapore proposed that nations delay a vote on whether to charge the world’s shipping fleet for their carbon emissions as the US keeps up pressure to block the plan.】

item.title: 被玷污项目中的大部分碳信用额被认为是假的
item.description:
经过两年的调查，世界上最大的碳补偿认证机构的调查结果为陷入困境的碳市场提出了紧迫的问题。【原文：

After a two-year probe, findings by the world's largest offset certifier raise pressing questions for the struggling carbon markets.

】

item.title: 新加坡启动进口马来西亚清洁能源的新计划
item.description: 新加坡有条件地批准从马来西亚沙捞越州计划中的一个 1 千兆瓦项目进口低碳电力，同时还同意探索与马来西亚半岛建立一个新的 2 千兆瓦跨境连接。【原文：Singapore gave conditional approval to import low-carbon electricity from a 1-gigawatt project planned in Malaysia’s Sarawak state, while also agreeing to explore a new 2-gigawatt cross-border link with Peninsular Malaysia.】

item.title: 调查显示澳大利亚西海岸谷物收成或将创纪录
item.description: 西澳大利亚州是澳大利亚最大的谷物生产州，由于天气强劲以及从畜牧业转向种植业，该州今年可能收获破纪录的作物，这有可能加剧全球小麦供应过剩的局面。【原文：Western Australia, the nation’s biggest grain-producing state, may harvest a record-breaking crop this year thanks to strong weather and a shift from livestock to cropping, potentially exacerbating a global wheat glut.】

item.title: BlueOrchard 称日本客户寻求海外影响力投资
item.description: 施罗德集团（Schroders Group）旗下的BlueOrchard Finance Ltd.公司表示，日本投资者正在寻求海外机会，以推动影响力投资，该公司主要在新兴市场采用这一策略。【原文：Japanese investors are seeking overseas opportunities as they boost impact investments, according to Schroders Group’s BlueOrchard Finance Ltd., which applies the strategy primarily in emerging markets.】
